intro: Nordenstamia juninensis, commonly known as the Junín nordenstamia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
